input_text:
Job Title: Analyst III, Compliance Operations (Remote)

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
At TruStage, we’re on a mission to make a brighter financial future accessible to everyone. We put people first, and work hand in hand with employees and customers to create a diverse and inclusive environment. Passionate about building insurance, investment and technology solutions, we push the boundaries of what’s possible. We need you to help us shape what’s next. You’ll be encouraged to share your experiences, ideas and skills to help others take control of their financial future.

Join a team that has received numerous awards for being a top place to work: TruStage awards and recognition

Job Purpose

This position is responsible for reducing enterprise compliance risk by executing and improving assigned compliance processes. This role may include activities such as policy documentation and implementation, regulatory research, process execution, documentation, quality assurance and continuous improvement, measurement and reporting, and stakeholder communication. This role will take on increasing levels of responsibility for multiple compliance processes and will develop a deep understanding of TruStage’s business model, strategy and objectives, and the laws and regulations applicable to the assigned areas of responsibility.

Job Responsibilities

Execute multiple assigned compliance processes.Identify compliance risks and opportunities for risk mitigation and improvement.Document compliance policies and implementation plans.Research applicable regulatory requirements and compliance risks.Follow established quality assurance and audit practices to evaluate the effectiveness of compliance processes at reducing enterprise compliance risks. Measure and report company performance in assigned compliance areas.Communicate effectively with relevant stakeholders about compliance risks, compliance processes, and applicable metrics.Understand TruStage’s enterprise business model and associated legal requirements and compliance risks.Anticipate and develop risk mitigation strategies for new legal and compliance risks to TruStage, based on changes in the external legal and regulatory environment within the assigned subject matter area(s), and TruStage’s business model.Use Microsoft Office applications (Teams, Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, SharePoint, etc.) and other technology applications and systems related to assigned processes. Perform assignments independently without daily oversight or instruction from others.

The above statement of duties is not intended to be all inclusive and other duties will be assigned from time to time.

Job Requirements

Bachelor's degree or an equivalent trade-off of related professional work experience; degree in Insurance-related or Business-related field(s) is preferred.3 or more years’ relevant experience; this is mid-level position with opportunity for continued development and promotion.Ability to understand TruStage’s enterprise business model and associated legal requirements and compliance risks.Ability to understand how compliance processes mitigate legal, compliance and business risks and apply that understanding to the daily work of individuals and teams.Ability to adapt in a changing work environment and assist others in understanding how and why changes impact compliance processes.Ability to work in a team environment.Effective written and verbal communication, interpersonal and organizational skills.Computer skills including Microsoft Office Suite (Teams, Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, SharePoint, etc.) and ability to learn to use technology applications and systems related to assigned processes. 

If you’re ready to help make a difference, apply today. Please provide your Work Experience and Education or attach a copy of your resume. Applications received without this information may be removed from consideration.

Compensation may vary based on the job level, your geographic work location, position incentive plan and exemption status.

Base Salary Range

$69,000.00 - $103,400.00

At TruStageTM, we believe a sound, inclusive benefits program is of vital importance, along with a flexible workplace that allows for work-life balance, career growth and retirement assistance. In addition to your base pay, your position may be eligible for an annual incentive (bonus) plan. Additional benefits available to eligible employees include medical, dental, vision, employee assistance program, life insurance, disability plans, parental leave, paid time off, 401k, and tuition reimbursement, just to name a few. Beyond pay and benefits, we also recognize that flexibility, including working in a place you prefer, is essential to caring for our employees. We will continue to strive to offer flexibility and invest in technology and other tools that will make hybrid working normal rather than an exception, so that when “life happens,” you can focus on what’s most important.

Accommodation request

TruStage is a place where everyone can bring their best self and thrive. If you need application or interview process accommodations, please contact the accessibility department.

Experience Level (if available): None
